name: TCPW Dark Knight — Cinematic Production
description: Texas Commercial Pressure Washing reimagined through The Dark Knight aesthetic. Industrial service as high-stakes tactical rescue. Houston urban noir.

project.weather: Wet. Always wet. Humid Houston night air, rain-slicked surfaces, water vapor from pressure washers.
project.time: Night — all scenes take place at night

colorGrade.shadows: crushed blacks with deep blue undertones (#001B2E)
colorGrade.highlights: warm amber from sodium vapor and tungsten (#FFB347, #FF8C00)
colorGrade.saturation: desaturated with selective warmth on skin and practicals

lens.characteristics: oval bokeh, horizontal blue-tinted flares, subtle barrel distortion
lens.depthOfField: motivated — shallow for reveals, deep for establishing scope

sceneSpecific.heroReveal: 85mm f/2.8 — compress background, pop tactical textures
sceneSpecific.crewWide: 35mm f/4 — natural focus falloff separating crew from stadium
sceneSpecific.pursuit: 24mm f/5.6 — wheel-level, speed distortion at edges
sceneSpecific.resolution: 85mm tracking — telephoto compression stacks steam layers

lighting.philosophy: motivated practicals only — every light has a source

sources.astrodome: top-down tungsten from stadium rafters + cool-blue LED vehicle light bars
sources.streets: sodium vapor streetlights (orange pools) + convoy LED strobes (cool blue)
sources.garage: overhead fluorescent + vehicle headlights + pressure washer work lights
sources.signal: high-intensity xenon beam, blue-white core, amber diffusion edges

lighting.contrast: chiaroscuro — faces in partial shadow, embrace darkness as compositional element

realism.entropy: CRITICAL — scuffed carbon fiber, dried water spots on visors, brass patina, cracked asphalt, oil stains, worn gear. Nothing pristine.
realism.texture: film grain (subtle), lens imperfections, chromatic aberration on bright sources

hero.name: TCPW Lead Operative
hero.look: Tactical Industrial PPE — NOT superhero costume

gear.armor: reinforced carbon-fiber plating on forearms and shins (spray back-pressure protection)
gear.belt: utility belt with brass quick-connects, high-tensile carabiners, industrial fittings
gear.helmet: tactical full-face respirator/visor hybrid — fighter pilot meets welding gear, matte finish, scuffed from use, HUD reflects Houston skyline
gear.texture: WORN. Dried water spots, scuffing on carbon fiber, metallic sheen on brass fittings

hero.identity: anonymous, intimidating, grounded in real-world industrial context
hero.consistency: same outfit from Astrodome reveal through pursuit through cleanup — this IS the brand icon

crew.gear: matching tactical industrial PPE with role-specific variations
roles: surface cleaner operator — carries heavy-duty surface cleaner like a shield
hose reel handler — tactical precision with high-pressure lines

propertyManager.name: Property Manager
propertyManager.role: the client in crisis — discovers disaster, activates signal, watches resolution
propertyManager.arc: panic → signal activation → relief/smile as hero disappears into mist

truck.name: TCPW Truck
truck.features: LED light bars, equipment racks, TCPW branding
truck.note: current AI refs score 4/10 realism — need regeneration or photobash

interceptor.name: TCPW Interceptor
interceptor.look: matte-black, low-slung frame, exposed hydraulic lines, oversized rugged tires, LED strobes
interceptor.note: hero's personal vehicle — tech-forward, low-profile motorcycle

scenes.arc: Crisis Discovery → Signal → Astrodome Reveal → Tactical Pursuit → Arrival → Deployment/Cleanup → Resolution
scenes.keyFrame: Scene 3 (Astrodome Reveal) is THE hero shot — most important frame for project identity

videoReadiness.editingStyle: mechanical ballet — intercut wide tracking with macro inserts
videoReadiness.shutterAngle: 45-degree staccato for cleanup sequence (Saving Private Ryan style)
considerations: wet surfaces catch motion blur naturally
